text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I want to show you

how I like to make my Mexican Street Corn
Salad, or you can also use it as a dip, it's

really fantastic and easy, so, so simple to
make, and everyone, including kids really
love it.

It's the perfect thing to make if you want
to make it as a side dish or as an appetizer

to munch on as you're grilling, as you're
having people over, it's just so good.

Let me talk to you about the ingredients I've
got here, now I've got some really beautiful

sweet corn, what I've done to it is I've part
boiled it for about a half an hour in some

salted boiling water because otherwise it
wouldn't have a chance to cook all the way
through while we put it on the grill.

Then I've got a few really nice big scallions,
and what I have here is a half of a green
bell pepper.

Now, if you've been following me for a long
time then you know I'm not a huge, huge fan

of green bell peppers, but they do have their
place.

Here, because like I said earlier, kids really
do seem to love this recipe anytime I've made

it, I don't want to use a jalapeno or even
a poblano because it's a little too spicy,

so I substitute with a half of a green bell
pepper, and I still get that pepper flavor

without the sweetness of a red bell pepper,
and without the heat of a jalapeno, if that
makes any sense.

It's a great trick, but if you want some heat
in your life, by all means, couple it with

a couple of seeded jalapenos and you'll be
golden.

Alright, so I need to pop these on the outdoor
grill, I really want that smokey flavor.

I ordinarily would do this on the indoor grill,
just because it's easier for me to show you,

but we are living large and taking charge
here today, we are going to go outside and

we are going to grill it on the grill because
I really want that smokey flavor.

Just going to take a little bit of plain olive
oil and I'm just going to drizzle this all

around because I don't want anything to stick
on the grill, and I'm also going to grill

the pepper, and I'm also going to grill my
scallions because that really lovely charred

flavor is going to be exactly what I'm after,
so let's go outside and let's pop these on.

Alright, so I just popped my corn and scallions
and pepper on a hot grill for just a few minutes

until it developed really beautiful color
and I just took them off the grill and I'm

just letting them sit here to cool down a
bit because I don't want this to be piping

hot when we go to mix everything together,
plus I want to be able to handle it really
easily so I don't want this to be really hot.

Alright, so you'll need, the additional ingredients
are, fresh cilantro, some cotija cheese, and
you're going to need some mayo, lime and salt.

That's all you're going to need and it is
fabulous!

But now, we have to cut the kernels off the
corn, so here's what you do.

Take a large bowl, the same bowl you would
mix your salad in, and then you take a smaller

bowl that fits comfortable upside down in
the big bowl like that, a sharp knife, take

your corn and very carefully - now it's cooled
so I can handle it, and then just very carefully
just cut the kernels off.

I say carefully because, you know, it can
slip and you don't want to hit your glass

bowl or heaven forbid, touch your fingers
with your knife or anything, so just take

your time and cut all the kernels off the
corn.

Alright, so all of my corn has been cut off,
all my corn kernels, and now I'm just going

to chop lots of cilantro, a good half a cup,
now you can add less if you want to, but I

think that cilantro is a really big part of
what makes this so fresh and delightful, so

I'm just going to add, like I said, a good
half a cup of fresh cilantro, finely chopped,

and then I'm also going to go ahead and chop
up my scallions, dice up my little half of

a bell pepper here, and add it all to the
corn kernels.
Everything's chopped.

I'm going to need to add a really sort of
healthy pinch of salt, because corn is very,

very sweet and I haven't salted anything except
for the water that I boiled it in which wasn't

terribly salty, so you want to make sure it's
really well seasoned.

Now I'm going to add in a little bit of mayo,
not a lot because this is not a heavy dense

salad, squeeze or two of lime, this lime is
a little weak.
Let's give it two hands - alright!

Probably going to do the juice of a whole
lime because this one is embarrassing!
Embarrassing I tell ya!
It's like an upper body workout for today!
Alright, looks good.

Clean spoon, and now just carefully mix everything
together until it's well combined.
Now, I've already tasted this and it's perfection.

So make sure that you taste it for seasoning
before you go to plate it, because once you

put it in your serving dish you want to pop
this into the fridge just to cool for a little

bit and you don't want to mess with it after
that.

Now, what I'm going to do - it's so good - Unbelievably
good!

So now what you want to do is you just want
to take some cotija cheese, which is a crumbly

delicious salty cheese, if you can't find
it, then go ahead and substitute it with a
little parm, or no cheese at all.

If you don't want to bother with the cheese,
but I'm telling you together it is the stuff

of dreams, you can serve this as a side dish
and it would be fantastic, you can serve this

as an appetizer with a little tortilla chip,
which is what I'm going to do right about
this second.
[crunch]
This is life.

It is everything you want to pick at on a
hot summer day.
Mmm!
Hands down, best corn salad on the planet.

LauraintheKitchen.com will have you covered
with the recipe, make it, share a photo on

social media, hope you enjoyed spending time
with me.
I'm just going to steal this one.
I'll see you next time.
Bye!
